resource.chars:
Dismissing therefore from further consideration 
these portions (constituting two thirds of the 
paper) the remainder may be regarded 
as its sum & substance.
This portion relates especially to the 
apparent origin and development of 
the Cysticercus cellulosae and the statements 
contained in are detailed at considerable 
length in the proceedings of the R. Soc.
Vol VIII p.549. Mr Rainey’s
explanation of certain appearances 
observed by him in the muscular substance 
of “measly pork” is so completely 
as it seems to me, at variance with all 
that has been satisfactorily demonstrated 
by many most accurate & laborious 
observers respecting the origin & development 
of the Cysticercus cellulosae, or more
